name: NPR
text:
A DOJ investigation found that corrections officers in Alabama men's prisons frequently use excessive, and at times, deadly force in violation of inmates' constitutional rights in 12 out of 13 prisons reviewed.
https://t.co/LpjO4JEshW

name: NPR
text: TikTok is seeking ways to distance itself from its Chinese parent company as the White House considers economic sanctions to cut off the popular app from U.S. users. https://t.co/hJjpjUPa6x

name: NPR
text:
Southwest and American Airlines will require all customers over the age of 2 to wear masks on board and at airports ‚Äî no exceptions. 

The airlines say, as of next week, people who don't comply will not be allowed to fly.
https://t.co/KZUzezfGUV

name: NPR
text:
Disney says it has pushed back or canceled the release dates of 17 films ‚Äî including the live-action remake of "Mulan," three "Star Wars" pictures and four "Avatar" sequels.
https://t.co/S4IvskWG8B

name: NPR
text:
President Trump acknowledged that public schools should delay reopening in coronavirus hotspots ‚Äî but said they should open fully if they want to receive tens of billions of dollars in new federal aid.
https://t.co/DMYO7R68Ra

name: NPR
text:
NEW: A federal judge has temporarily barred federal officers in Portland from arresting, threatening to arrest or using force against anyone they "reasonably should know" is a legal observer or journalist documenting daily protests. (@OPB)
https://t.co/8w77dpeA3f

name: NPR
text:
Venezuelans trapped in Ecuador by COVID-19 are determined to make the trip back ‚Äî on foot if they have to. 

üîäThe story of their return and the 53-year-old civil servant leading one group home, from @Roughly @elhilopodcast + @radioambulante. 
https://t.co/cJIq2FfiPo

name: NPR
text:
There have been just 11 COVID-19 deaths in Jordan. 

‚ÄúWe did everything we can to make sure our children, our elderly, our refugees ‚Äî you know, the haves and the have-nots ‚Äî are protected,‚Äù says the prime minister.  https://t.co/iOnmiLFzTe

name: NPR
text:
The body of civil rights icon John Lewis will lie in state at the U.S. Capitol next week.

The congressman's family is urging non-locals to pay tribute virtually, instead of traveling to Washington, D.C., because of the pandemic.
https://t.co/VMjBGua7d3

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Louis Tran went to New York to aid ICUs grappling with COVID-19. Now, he's fighting the virus in California.

"It's difficult when you're just being bombarded," he says.  "That's the calling of emergency medicine and we answer the call 24/7."
https://t.co/BjtylNzHzo

name: NPR
text:
Erika James, the first woman and first Black person to lead the Wharton School, says the business world has the ability and should create a more diverse work environment, but it hasn't "prioritized it."
https://t.co/dp4B6azrCX

name: NPR
text:
"It was a false flag operation." 

A Turkish admiral and some of his fellow officers say they are convinced President Erdogan staged a 2016 coup attempt in an effort to expand power, though analysts cast doubt that Erdogan was behind it.
https://t.co/GnvCKwIGNz

name: NPR
text:
For years, refugees seeking asylum at the Canadian border have been turned back because they crossed through another country that offers human rights protections.

But now a judge has ruled the U.S. treatment of the refugees violates human rights.
https://t.co/KrXmgHjhT6

name: NPR
text:
Researchers analyzed the data from every study on the protective effect of masks. 

Their bottom-line estimate: If 95% of people wear cloth masks, it reduces transmission by at least 30%.

With this example, here's what happens over seven 5-day cycles üëá
https://t.co/wVSl0NX4nP https://t.co/dVF4Tyt3CO

name: NPR
text: China's Foreign Ministry has ordered the closure of the U.S. consulate in Chengdu. The move is in apparent retaliation to a U.S. order to close the Chinese consulate in Houston earlier this week. https://t.co/K2STTw0gjj

name: NPR
text:
The U.S. Space Force has accused Russia of testing an anti-satellite weapon from one of its satellites in orbit ‚Äî marking the first time the military has publicly charged Moscow with carrying out a space-based weapons test.
https://t.co/2boUGY2y4N

name: NPR
text:
In 1929, the President of Mexico gave Charles Lindbergh a painting by artist Alfredo Ramos Mart√≠nez. 

Now, almost a century after Mart√≠nez painted the "Flores Mexicanas," it was seen in public for just the second time.
https://t.co/LzY7yxSRO8

name: NPR
text:
The real star of Netflix's ‚ÄúFloor Is Lava‚Äù ‚Äî is the lava. 

The magma is the result of months of work by Hollywood's top slime manufacturers. (Fun fact: It smells like bubble gum.) https://t.co/3eunoTfg0W

name: NPR
text: President Trump's deployment federal forces in U.S. cities, answerable only to him, "is manifestly unconstitutional," Harvard law professor Laurence Tribe writes for @WBUR. "This is not mere disregard for the rule of law -- this is outright disdain." https://t.co/RNY2AhaKuI
